business.headline: Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

entertainment.headline: Telugu actor Nani reveals why he went ahead with HIT 3 event amid Indo-Pak tensionsTelugu actor Nani was called out for holding 'HIT 3' success event amid escalating Indo-Pak tensions. He stated that he didn't want to give terrorists the satisfaction of cancelling an event.

PVR sues Maddock Films after cancellation of Bhool Chuk Maaf theatrical releasePVR has sued Maddock Films for Rs 60 crore for the last-minute cancellation of the theatrical release of Bhool Chuk Maaf. Maddock Films is yet to release an official statement on the same.

Black, White and Gray: The uncomfortable fiction of this highly rated crime series'Black, White and Gray - Love Kills' is a gripping mockumentary series on SonyLIV that blurs the line between fiction and reality with its true-crime-style storytelling set in Nagpur. This six-episode show masterfully explores obsession and truth, leaving viewers questioning what is real in relationships and crime.

All about film on Operation Sindoor, makers' apology and clarificationFilmmaker Uttam Maheshwari deleted the poster of his film titled 'Operation Sindoor', and also apologised for hurting the sentiments of people, while India continues to defend its sovereignty amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

Rhea Chakraborty's moving tribute to Indian army: From one fauji home to another...Actor Rhea Chakraborty wrote an emotional and empowering note as the 'daughter' of an Indian army officer. She sent her love to the families of the soldiers who are fighting for the country amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

3 films, 3 different genres in Vijay Deverakonda's promising line-upActor Vijay Deverakonda announced his solid line-up of films on Friday. He shared the posters of the three films, indicating that the three belong to different genres.

When Nimrat Kaur recalled terrorists killing her father: Was kidnapped, terminatedActor Nimrat Kaur is the daughter of an army major who was martyred in 1994. In an interview, she once spoke about what she remembered from the day when she realised she had lost her father to terrorism.

Actors Khushbu, Radikaa Sarathukumar support Aarti over Ravi Mohan in divorce battleActors Khushbu Sundar and Radikaa Sarathkumar expressed their support for Aarti over actor Ravi Mohan in their divorce battle. This comes after Aarti's emotional yet strongly-worded statement following Ravi's latest public appearance with rumoured partner Kenishaa Francis.

Suits LA Season 2 cancelled after poor reviews: Report'Suits LA' Season 2 has been cancelled after the spin-off series received bad reviews and poor ratings upon its debut in February this year. The show has already premiered its 10 episodes.

Ram Charan receives warm welcome in London ahead of wax statue inauguration. PicsRam Charan's wax statue at Madame Tussauds London will be launched tomorrow. As he arrived in London, he received a loud cheers and warm welcome from his fans.

I'm nothing if not Indian: Hina Khan's strong note for trolls 'across the border'Hina Khan wrote a strongly-worded note against people 'across the border' who have been abusing her, cursing her and wishing the worst for her given her medical condition. She earlier expressed support for her country and the armed forces following Operation Sindoor against Pakistan-backed terrorism.

Indian cinema's queer journey: From margins to mainstreamIndian cinema has gradually shifted from stereotypical portrayals of queer characters to more authentic and nuanced stories. This evolution reflects broader social shifts and growing acceptance of queer identities in India.

Aamir Khan postpones Sitaare Zameen Par trailer launch amid Indo-Pak tensionsActor Aamir Khan has postponed the trailer release of his upcoming film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' amid rising India-Pakistan border tensions. The decision reflects solidarity with the armed forces and a call for national unity during sensitive times.

Raid 2 box office Day 9: Ajay's film smashes Rs 100 crore, actor's 15th in the clubAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has surpassed the benchmark of Rs 100 crore at the box office. The film witnessed a drop in its collection during the weekdays, given the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. However, it continued to perform decently.

Khloe Kardashian 'loved seeing King Khan' at Met Gala, calls SRK 'amazing'Khloe Kardashian joined millions of those who think Shah Rukh Khan looked dashing in his Sabyasachi-designed look at Met Gala 2025. She shared a few photos of the superstar on Snapchat, and referred to him as 'King Khan'

'Godzilla x Kong: Supernova' Confirmed for 2027, production begins on Monsterverse SequelWarner Bros. confirms Godzilla x Kong: Supernova for March 2027 with production underway. Teaser hints at Titan activity, Monarch's return, and fan-favorite Easter eggs in the expanding Monsterverse saga.

John Cena returns in 'Peacemaker' Season 2 trailer packed With DC CameosJohn Cena returns in the action-packed Peacemaker Season 2 trailer, featuring new characters and surprise cameos. Premiering August 21 on Max, the season explores deeper emotional arcs and conflict.

Falaq Naaz questions loyalty of fellow actors towards the nation: I feel sorryTelevision actor Falaq Naaz has openly criticised Muslim actors in the Indian entertainment industry for their silence amidst the India-Pakistan conflict, urging them to show loyalty to India.

general news.headline: Pakistan dialled India, both sides agreed to a ceasefire: New DelhiIndia-Pakistan ceasefire: Pakistan initiated contact with India, and both sides agreed to a ceasefire, effective from 5 pm Saturday, after direct talks between their military officials, the government said.

Live: India, Pak agreed to stop all military activities on sea, air, landIndia-Pakistan Ceasefire news: India and Pakistan reached a truce on Saturday after three days of intensive military conflict following the talks mediated by the US. After days of rising tensions between India and Pakistan, US President Donald Trump announced on his Truth Social platform that both countries had agreed to a ceasefire after a night of talks. The two countries have also agreed to hold high-level diplomatic talks on May 12 at noon. Later, the External Affairs Ministry and Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar also confirmed the truce. The ceasefire came into effect from 5 pm (IST) on Saturday, May 10, 2025. Follow live updates here:

Here on, India will treat terror attacks as acts of war against countryIndia has resolved to treat any future terror attacks as an act of war and will respond accordingly. The decision was taken following the Pahalgam terror attack, which left 26 dead.

JF-17 didn't damage our S-400: India calls out Pak lieIndia rejected Pakistan's claim that its JF-17 damaged the S-400 and BrahMos missile bases, with the Defence Ministry calling the allegation "completely wrong".

Pakistan resorts to the war it knows best: Jihad in subcontinentOn Saturday, the world witnessed the launch of a fresh season of Pakistan's perennial chimera of a fragmented India when it announced 'Bunyan-un-Marsoos', a military strike on India. The symbolism of the operation and the surrounding propaganda underlines a larger insidious plan to use Islam as a ruse to support terror, rally support and destabilise the Subcontinent

Masood Azhar's brothers-in-law, Lashkar HQ chief killed in Op Sindoor: SourcesMudassar Khadian Khas, Hafiz Muhammed Jameel, Mohammad Yusuf Azhar, Khalid (Abu Akasha) and Mohammad Hassan Khan were eliminated in Operation Sindoor.

India, Pakistan agree to ceasefire after long night of talks, says TrumpIndia-Pakistan ceasefire: The US said India and Pakistan, who have exchanged fire over the past three days after Operation Sindoor, would start talks on a broad set of issues at a neutral site.

Official beggars: Asaduddin Owaisi roasts Pakistan after IMF bailoutAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi called on global powers to ensure that Pakistan's nuclear bombs are disarmed as it continued with its drone attacks across the border.

Face of Pakistan's military is son of a terroristHeading Pakistan's disinformation campaign against India's anti-terror fight is Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, the Director General of Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR). Chaudhry is the son of nuclear scientist Sultan Bashiruddin Mahmood, who met al-Qaida chief Osama bin Laden and tried to hand over nuclear weapons technology to terrorists. He features on the UN Security Council's al-Qaida Sanctions Committee list of terrorists.

Pak moving troops to forward areas, Indian forces on alert: GovernmentIndia-Pakistan conflict: After Pakistan targeted 26 military locations across four states, the government said India carried out precision strikes at four Pakistani airbases.

Pak targets 4 air stations, India counters with precision strikes at 6 basesDuring a special briefing on the escalating conflict, Colonel Sophia Qureshi stated that Pakistan attempted to strike 26 strategic sites throughout the night, including air bases and transport hubs. A high-speed missile was also fired at an airbase in Punjab at around 1.40 am.

Madrasa students second line of defence: Pak Defence Minister in Parliament Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif raised eyebrows when, during a Parliament session, he declared that students would "100 per cent" be used as a "second line of defence" whenever the time comes.

Video: Army destroys Pak posts, drone launch pads in precision strikesIndia on Friday said Pakistan had launched between 300 and 400 Turkish drones across locations from Leh to Sir Creek in its failed attempt to target Indian military installations

How India, with pictorial evidence, demolished Pakistan's tissue of liesTo counter the false narrative, India released time-stamped images and videos showing the airbases in full operational condition. The visuals depicted normalcy and no visible damage to the military installations targeted in Pakistani propaganda.

India's response always responsible, remains so, S Jaishankar tells USAfter speaking with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Dr S Jaishankar reaffirmed India's stance, stating that its approach amid rising Indo-Pak tensions "has always been measured and responsible."

Why India hit 6 Pak air bases including Chaklala, Rafiqui and MuridLocated just 10 km from Islamabad, Chaklala air base is one of Pakistan's most sensitive military compounds and serves both air force operations and VIP transport.

Pakistan's Operation Bunyan al-Marsoos: Why the name, what it meansPakistan has massively escalated the standoff with India by firing drones and missiles, including Fattah-1 ballistic missile. It has named its operation Bunyan al-Marsoos. This is a verse from the Quran. What does the name mean, and why has Pakistan named its military mission Bunyan al-Marsoos?

India has moral high ground, should take strategic high ground too: Fareed ZakariaIn an interview with India Today TV, Fareed Zakaria stressed that India must act with long-term strategy in mind. "India has the moral high ground but it has the most to lose from a massive escalation," he said.

Virat Kohli informs BCCI he wants to retire from Tests before England tour: SourcesA top BCCI official has urged Virat Kohli to reconsider his decision after the former captain informed the board of his willingness to retire from Test cricket. India are set to tour England for a five-Test series, starting on June 20.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: Foreign players fly out of India suspension of tournamentThe Indian Premier League have sent their foreign players back home amid India-Pakistan border tensions. Players left for their homes via different locations.

Barcelona vs Real Madrid: Latest live streaming detailsBarcelona and Real Madrid will meet in a decisive LaLiga clash on May 11. The shift in streaming rights to FanCode has sparked debate amongst Indian football fans.

Can India avenge the Asia Cup heartbreak against Sri Lanka in grand finale?Harmanpreet Kaur's India and Chamari Athapaththu's Sri Lanka will face each other in the summit clash of the tri-nation series on Sunday, May 11 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

From Dhoni to Rohit: Indian stars BGT forced to retireIndia captain Rohit Sharma called time on his Test career ahead India's tour of England. Rohit was amongst the long list of Indian cricketers who called time on their careers after playing against Australia.

RCB players safely reach Bengaluru amid India-Pakistan tensionsIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru players and other personnel reached Bengaluru on Saturday as the BCCI took the call of suspending the IPL for seven days.

UAE retire out entire team in Women's T20 World Cup QualifiersUAE beat Qatar by 163 runs in the Women's T20 World Cup Asia Qualifiers 2025 after skipper Esha Rohit Oza scored a hundred and picked up a wicket at the Terdthai Cricket Ground in Bangkok.

Anahat, Abhay make winning starts at Squash World ChampionshipYoung Indian squash stars Anahat Singh and Abhay Singh secured victories in their opening matches at the World Championship. Their wins set up challenging next rounds against higher-ranked Egyptian players, promising intense competition ahead.

Arsenal agree Martin Zubimendi deal with Real Sociedad: ReportsArsenal have reportedly won the race to sign Martin Zubimendi, agreeing to meet his 50 million pounds release clause and securing a verbal agreement with the Spanish midfielder, who is expected to become their first signing of the 2025 summer window.

Ukraine's Kostyuk shakes hands with Kasatkina, praises anti-war stanceUkrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk, known for her outspoken stance against Russia's invasion of Ukraine and her refusal to shake hands with Russian or Belarusian opponents, offered a handshake to Daria Kasatkina after defeating her 6-4, 6-2 in the second round of the Italian Open.

India men's compound team wins gold at Archery World Cup Stage 2India's compound men's team won gold, the women's team bagged silver, and the mixed team claimed bronze at the Archery World Cup Stage 2 in Shanghai—marking a successful outing and continuing their impressive form ahead of future international events.

Mohammed Afsal breaks 800m national record in UAE Athletics Grand PrixIndia's Mohammed Afsal set a new national record in the men's 800m race at the UAE Athletics Grand Prix 2025 in Dubai, clocking 1:45.61.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
